BUDOKON WORKSHOP with Winnie & Anja In this transformative Workshop we invite you to embrace THE WAY OF THE WARRIOR SPIRIT. Budokon Yoga is a dynamic fusion of traditional Hatha Yoga, martial art stances, animal locomotion, mobility, & meditation. This powerful practice is a gateway to unlocking physical and mental focus and precision, making it the perfect journey for the athletic yogi seeking to unleash their inner warrior.  During this workshop, Winnie and Anja will guide you through the signature moves found in the Budokon Primary Series, including the Cobra Roll, Rolling Vinyasa, various Floating Frog and arm balance variations, empowering Double Block, and transitions to Warriors Bridge. We’ll be combining a strong and circular sequence of yogic asanas, standing balances & transitions that elevate your muscular strength, enhance your body control, improve stability, and boost agility and mobility. At the heart of it all, we will help you cultivate and experience the pure state of Zen Mind, achieving both inner and outer harmony. Join us on this remarkable journey to your best self. Date: January 13th, 2024Time: 14-17hPrice 50 EUR WINNIE from Hamburg ignited her way into the Budokon world in 2019 and then BDK Yoga & Mobility at Budokon University in Miami in early 2020.This year she finished the BDK Yoga Secondary Series at Budokon University in Montana. Her classes are interactive, challenging not just physically but also mentally, giving space and sharing a hand with all those on their special Budokon path. She is now enjoying the full Budokon journey, sharing passion, strength, and love with those who are in search of it, building with lots of patience and deepest love for the BUDOKON Community. Having completed her Budokon Yoga training with Melyane Shayne in 2019, Anja brings a powerful and fluid teaching style while ensuring accessibility for all levels. With her calm and precise guidance, coupled with thoughtfully crafted sequences, Anja skillfully challenges her students, fostering a focused demeanor and a Warrior mind. Skillful, mindful, conscious assists are a powerful way to deepen a practitioners physical experience of an asana while sharpening their personal awareness. This workshop is for both teachers and practitioners who would like to deepen their understanding in the principles of safe and effective hands-on-assists and deepen their understanding of energetic lines. Class will begin with an energetic warm up that will activate the postures covered for the workshop. Through partner work we will learn the essentials of giving and receiving assists, explore how to support others while improving our own practice in the process. Workshop Name: Jump Back Jump Through Foundations of Ashtanga Yoga with Melina & Alex
Beschreibung: One of the most fundamental, yet challenging parts, of the Ashtanga Vinyasa Yoga method practice is learning to ‘float back’ and ‘glide through’. It seems impossible at first, and can take years to master. However, the journey can be also be viewed as an enjoyable exploration of your body. In this energizing and fun Ashtanga Yoga workshop, we will have a closer look at the outer (physical body mechanics / what are those bandhas the teacher won’t stop talking about?) and inner (emotional and sometimes scary) requirements of jumping back and through. Using clever adaptations, partner work, props and special skill-building techniques, we will explore the key components required to start finally get you to start floating.

Aerial Hammock ist ein Tuch, welches von der Decke hängt. Dabei sollte man das Aerial Hammock allerdings nicht mit dem gemütlichen Abhängen in einer Hängematte verwecheln. We’ll be combining a strong and circular sequence of yogic asanas, standing balances & transitions that elevate your muscular strength, enhance your body control, improve stability, and boost agility and mobility. At the heart of it all, we will help you cultivate and experience the pure state of Zen Mind, achieving both inner and outer harmony. Join us on this remarkable journey to your best self. Der Workshop beginnt mit einer kurzen meditativen Yogasequenz, so dass Du gut auf das Geben und Empfangen der Massage vorbereitet bist. Thaimassage wird bekleidet ausgeführt. Du solltest aber zum massieren sowie zum massiert werden bequeme Wohlfühl-Kleidung tragen (Sportbekleidung). Alle anderen Hilfsmittel stehen ausreichend im Balance zur Verfügung.
